availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas C. Westfall (Mason County teacher and postmaster)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, teacher and postmaster. Ohio native. Married to Mary Katherine Westfall. Father of Sara Louise Westfall. Teacher in Mason County in 1860. Postmaster of Minerva from 1862 to 1866.

ab.bibl:
“Westfall, Thomas C.,” Spring Grove Cemetery, http://www.springgrove.org/stats/98954.tif.pdf.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #15722, Kenton County Deaths, p. unknown.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Carroll County, Washington, p. 107. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 69. Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, vol. 28, p. 137, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
